title: Ticket #4351: Improve scalability of DAGMan workflow log
description:
Someone (I think from Fermi) suggested this at HTCondor Week.

Anyhow, the idea is this: If you have a really big DAG (hundreds of thousands of nodes, say), have DAGMan automatically use a set of workflow logs instead of a single workflow log.

My first thought is that this wouldn't require any change to the schedd; DAGMan would just have to figure out how many files to use based on how many nodes you have, and specify them on accordingly on the condor_submit command line for each node job.

Have to think about whether this really is a good idea, and whether it's worth doing, but I wanted to at least record the idea...
